The more points you have at the end of the experiment, the more like you will win in the lottery.\nPlease click “Proceed” to receive detailed information about the study.

In each week, you may contract a hypothetical disease. You can decide either for or against a vaccination. The vaccine becomes effective only after ?? hours after you have vaccinated.
Depending on your decision, you can be in one of three stages:
 1. Susceptible: You either did not vaccinate or vaccinated within the last ?? hours, so the vaccine is not effective yet. You may be contracting the disease.
 2. Vaccinated: You vaccinated at least ?? hours before and cannot contract the disease.
 3. Infected: You did not vaccinate and contracted the disease. You may infect others.

Please click Proceed to learn about the potential consequences of non-vaccination.
Vaccination costs 10 points. It prevents from contracting the disease from 2 hours after pressing the button until the end of the round. Additional point losses due to side effects might appear.
